result.execSummary:
The defendant Dillon T. Ray was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Jefferson County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes:
--to pay restitution of $251 to Todd Knoll

--to pay costs and surcharges on each count 

--On Case #16CF42 only: to pay restitution to Optum in an amount to be determined at a Restitution Hearing; however if the entity known as Optum has not responded to the Distric Attorney's Office request for clarification and further data in support of its restitution request by the Restitution Hearing date, then the hearing will be taken off the calendar and no restitution is ordered in Caes #16CF42

6/3/16: Court orders restitution in the amount of $1198.06, payable to Mr. Knoll (for radiology, deductible, and eye doctor) 
Court finds that restitution figure of $13,056.87 owed to Optum, under prevailing law that at present time, that Mr. Ray does not have the ability to pay this amt. in toto; however if Mr. Ray does obtain employment this order can be changed. The Court informs parties that It will also consider civil judgment prior to discharge of probation as well. 

Court orders restitution to Mr. Knoll to be paid as condition of probation
--to pay costs and surcharges on each count
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent

--no acts or threats of violence toward any person

--to maintain absolute sobriety: no alcohol, no controlled substances other than those authorized by appropriate prescription

--no contact with Todd Knoll, William Lawrence, or Justin Magsamen

--to undergo any assessment, treatment, and counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent

--to take all prescription drugs as prescribed

--to engage in a Criminal Thinking and/or Anger Management program per the Agent

--to provide a DNA sample 

Arresting Agency: Watertown PD

If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment  per the Agent

records.addlTxt: Restitution payment - per 2/2/17 Order to Disburse. 17C 010678
to Disburse Restitution in the amount of $250  cc: DA (electronically) , Bookkeeping, Atty De La Rosa  /tn  2-3-17
to Disburse Restitution in the amount of $250

Case called at 3:50 pm [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Dillon T. Ray in court with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty De La Rosa informs the Court that he did receive some emails from ADA Hall regarding amts. covered and relevant restitution information. Have no dispute with the amount requested from Mr. Knoll, but do have issues with ability to pay while under the Court's jurisdiction regarding the insurance claim.

Dillion Ray--sworn & testifies
--direct exam by Atty De La Rosa
--cross exam by ADA Hall
--exam by the Court
Arguments by Counsel
Court orders restitution in the amount of $1198.06, payable to Mr. Knoll (for radiology, deductible, and eye doctor) 
Court finds that restitution figure of $13,056.87 owed to Optum, under prevailing law that at present time, that Mr. Ray does not have the ability to pay this amt. in toto; however if Mr. Ray does obtain employment this order can be changed. The Court informs parties that It will also consider civil judgment prior to discharge of probation as well. 

Court orders restitution to Mr. Knoll to be paid as condition of probation
Recess: 4:14 pm 

NEXT: Clerk to Amend JOC
Restitution hearing on June 3, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

records.descr: Request and Order to Correct Clerical Error in JOC

records.addlTxt:
Clerk MK's note: in response to an inquiry raised regarding the action taken by the Court regarding restitution at the 4/29/16 Plea & Sentencing, the clerk realizes she incorrectly designated the case number in regard to the restitution that is at issue. The portion of the clerk's minutes regarding the restitution conditions of Probation should have been: 

"--On Case #16CF42 only: to pay restitution of $251 to Todd Knoll"
and
"--On Case #16CF42 only: to pay restitution to Optum in an amount to be determined at a Restitution Hearing; however if the entity known as Optum has not responded to the Distric Attorney's Office request for clarification and further data in support of its restitution request by the Restitution Hearing date, then the hearing will be taken off the calendar and no restitution is ordered in Caes #16CF42" 

Also, the Restitution Hearing scheduled before Judge Nettesheim on 6/3/16 at 3:00pm should be scheduled in Case #16CF42 (not in Case #16CF106).  
There is no restitution order or condition of Probation in Case #16CF106.
Criminal Case Settlement

Reserve Judge Nettesheim presiding for Branch IV:  
[MK] cases #16CF42, #16CF106, #16CM134 called at 11:57am.
Defendant Dillon T. Ray in court with Attorney Jeffrey J De La Rosa.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Waiver of Preliminary Hearing held in Case #16CF106:
--Mr. Ray waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.
--ADA Hall files an Information
--service of Information admitted, reading waived

On Motion of the State, the Court amends Count #1 of Case #16CF42 to Class A Misdemeanor Battery contrary to Statute 940.19(1) & 939.05.

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " No Contest " entered on Counts #1 & #2 of Case #16CF42 and on Count #1 of Case #16CF106; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #2 of Case #16CF106, and all counts in Case #16CM134.

On Case #16CF42-Counts #1 & #2, and on Case #16CF106-Count #1, the Court withholds sentence, and places Mr. Ray on Probation for two years, with conditions:
----On Case #16CF106 only to serve 30 days in the Jefferson County Jail, with work-release privileges, to commence forthwith
----to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per the Agent 
----to undergo any assessment, treatment, and counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
----no acts or threats of violence toward any person
----to maintain absolute sobriety: no alcohol, no controlled substances other than those authorized by appropriate prescription
----to take all prescription drugs as prescribed
----no contact with Todd Knoll, William Lawrence, or Justin Magsamen
----to engage in a Criminal Thinking and/or Anger Management program per the Agent
----to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--On Case #16CF42 only: to pay restitution of $251 to Todd Knoll
--On Case #16CF106: to pay restitution to Optum in an amount to be determined at a Restitution Hearing; however if the entity known as Optum has not responded to the Distric Attorney's Office request for clarification andfurther data in support of its restitution request by the Restitution Hearing date, then the hearing will be taken off the calendar and no restitution is ordered in Caes #16CF106 
--to pay costs and surcharges on each count 
--to provide a DNA sample 

Days credit for time already served:  1 day in Case #16CF42,  0 days in Case #16CF106 
The Court grants the Defendant's request to be allowed to petition for Expungment [upon the successful conclusion of the Probation term] in Case #16CF106.
recess 12:33pm.

Cases 16CF42 16CF106, and 16CM134 called together at 1:22pm [mo]
Defendant Dillon T. Ray in court, in custody with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa.  ADA Monica J. Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.

As to Cases 16CF106 and 16CM134 (Initial Appearance occurs):
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited.
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defendant

As to Case 16CM134:
The Court requires $750  signature bond, with conditions: 
--to maintain absolute 
--no possession or consumption of alcohol
--no possession or consumption of illegal drugs
--take all prescription drugs as prescribed
--no presence in bars, taverns, or liquor stores
--to commit no acts or threats of violence towards any person
--no contact with Justin Magsamen or Cheyenne Marx

As to Case 16CF106:
The Court requires $1000  signature bond, with conditions: 
--to maintain absolute 
--no possession or consumption of alcohol
--no possession or consumption of illegal drugs
--take all prescription drugs as prescribed
--no presence in bars, taverns, or liquor stores
--to commit no acts or threats of violence towards any person

ADA Hall orally motions for an amendment to bond in case 16CF42; gives arguments
--bond arguments given by Atty. De La Rosa 

--questioning by the Court

In Case 16CF42, the Court amends the bond to $250 CASH,
--to maintain absolute 
--no possession or consumption of alcohol
--no possession or consumption of illegal drugs
--take all prescription drugs as prescribed
--no presence in bars, taverns, or liquor stores
--to commit no acts or threats of violence towards any person

Parties waive time limits in all cases
Court and Counsel discuss scheduling.
recess: 1:40pm
